Atlanta.Crum & Forster Building:
The Crum & Forster Building is a 1928 three-story building with a Renaissance façade with columns and arches located at 771 Spring Street at Tech Square in Midtown Atlanta.


== History ==
The building was designed in 1926 by a team of New York and Atlanta architects — Ed Ivey and Lewis Crook, both Georgia Tech graduates who helped establish the Architecture program at Georgia Tech in 1908.., and opened in 1928 as a regional office for a national insurance firm.
In 2007, the Georgia Tech Foundation purchased the building, and sought permits to demolish the building as part of a plan to expand Technology Square.
